title: Padmashree Darshanam Mogilaiah passes away after prolonged illness, breathed his last at 73
text:
New Delhi: Padmashree Darshanam Mogilaiah was not only an actor but also a famous string instrumentalist. He died today on the morning of 19th December. He breathed his last in a hospital in Warangal, Telangana. He was undergoing treatment for kidney disease. He was 73 years old.
Darshanam Mogilaiah was one of the last remaining players of the instrument named ‘Kinera’. Because of his talent, he was also famous by the name Kinnara Mogulaiya. He was known for his important contribution to traditional folk music. He was awarded the Padma Shri in 2022. He was famous as a ‘Kinera’ player and folk singer. He was the last singer to master the 12 steps of the instrument.
Became famous with the film ‘Balagam’
Darshanam Mogilaiah got popularity from the film ‘Balagam’. He made the audience emotional by singing the song ‘Thoduga Maa Thodundi’, which was a special feature of the film. He also sang a part of the title song of Pawan Kalyan’s film ‘Bhimla Nayak’. Darshanam Mogilaiah’s wife Komuramma is also a folk artist. He left behind a son and a daughter.
Last rites will be held in ancestral village
Darshanam Mogilaiah was reportedly facing financial problems after both his kidneys failed. ‘Balagam’ producer Dil Raju and director Yeladandi Venu had helped him financially. Megastar Chiranjeevi and other actors had also expressed their intention to help the folk artist. The state government had also taken steps to provide medical treatment for them. According to IANS report, Assembly Speaker Gaddam Prasad Kumar had given Rs 1 lakh for the treatment of Darshanam Mogiyalayya. The last rites of Darshanam Mogilaiah will be performed in his native village Duggondi.
FIRST PUBLISHED: December 19, 2024, 15:59 IST
